Job Description: Elementary Education Internship Are you passionate about transforming elementary education and utilizing the methods and best practices you have learned in college before graduation? Join our team at the Bill of Rights Institute and you will be working with our learning design team as we create new educational resources for elementary school educators. If you excel in dynamic environments and are committed to making a tangible impact in education, this position is perfect for you. Responsibilities: Collaborate with the K-8 Learning Designer to Lexile content, including readings, articles, and other learning materials. Conduct research on state social studies standards and assist in aligning content to these standards. Work closely with the Education Team to develop supplemental resources within the 3-5 curriculum. Support the creation of new educational materials, including interactive activities, worksheets, and assessments. Ensure consistency in branding usage across all new materials, including maintaining visual design guidelines. Assist in proofreading and editing educational materials to ensure accuracy, clarity, and quality. Qualifications: Currently pursuing undergraduate studies in elementary education or history with a focus on teaching. Passion for education and a strong commitment to making a positive impact on student learning experiences. Knowledge of state social studies standards, preferably with experience in aligning content to these standards. Excellent research skills, with the ability to collect and analyze information from reliable sources. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and meet deadlines. Proficient in written and verbal communication, with exceptional attention to detail. Experience in instructional material development or curriculum design is a plus. Proficiency in using educational technology tools and applications is desirable.
